data.title: Fresh, Reliable Italian Food Done Right
data.text:
Hard to believe that between his original store on Flagler Street in Miami and the well-established location in Davie that Jeff Cohen has operated Pizza Loft for 41 years now! Well, his longevity is well deserved because the service is efficient and friendly, the atmosphere is uncrowded and relaxed, and the food is always reliably fresh and good. 

Our visit tonight came about because I really wanted good Italian food and PL was the top of my list. We were greeted by the affable Jeff himself and quickly escorted to a quiet booth. As mentioned, the floor is uncrowded and with very light background music you can actually hold a decent conversation.

Sandy was our server and greeted us within one minute. My wife ordered the chicken piccata and I had the award-winning lasagna with meatballs. We both had the fresh garden salad with excellent house-made dressing and we also enjoyed fresh, hot garlic rolls, light and fluffy, not dripping with garlic like you find elsewhere but slightly moist on the bottom and coated with a toasted garlic topping. Out of this world; I could eat them like candy.

Sandy explained that the lasagna would take about 20 minutes or a bit longer so I did have to fret about the time before our entrees arrived, and I didn't. We took our time with the salads and within moments, the main course arrived. The meatballs are light and done right and the lasagna was piping hot. I will admit I've had better but it was very good in its own right. The chicken piccata was superb, with each bite offering a hint of the unmistakably pungent flavor from the capers - just enough to let you know it was done right and the buttery lemon sauce was the kind you sop up with the garlic roll. Having eaten our fill, there was no room for dessert and so we passed on it. Our cost was just $38 plus tip for two main courses with salad and garlic rolls plus two bottles of San Pelligrino. 

We have had Jeff's pizza in the past and found it to be among the best in town. I also favor the chicken Marsala and when I'm in the mood, spaghetti with meatballs. Pizza Loft is easily reached, on University Drive north of Griffin Road before you get to Nova Drive on the east side. It's set way back from the street so don't be shy - you won't be sorry. Give Jeff some love the next time you want Italian.

data.title: Office luncheon
data.text: We had delivery of two large pizzas, one cheese and one peperoni along with a large side salad.  This is a crowd pleaser with my office and the food was good, the delivery was timely and the cost was very reasonable.

data.title: Great food / Great service
data.text:
8 of us came in for dinner and were greeted with a friendly smile by the owner Jeff . Sat and immediately were greeted by Kristina B . What a wonderful personality ,all servers should be as friendly and on point as she was throughout the  meal. The pizza was a whole wheat as i am diabetic and don't do white flour. It was hot and tasty and just very enjoyable. Our friends had various pizza and entrees all on point. Glad we came in and will certainly come back for more. 
Great friends great food great night

data.title: The best garlic rolls
data.text: The garlic rolls are amazing.  The pizza is delicious and not greasy.  Even when getting delivery the pizza stays crispy!  I have eaten in and received delivery and both are excellent.  If i had one negative thing to say is that they always get the onions part of my meal wrong.  When I ask for raw they put sauteed and if I ask for sauteed they put raw.  Other than that this is a superb pizza location!

data.title: Sharing a Pizza with Great friends
data.text: OMG they weren't kidding when everyone was raving about the garlic rolls!!! Crispy, airy inside and not dripping in grease, cooked to order and delivered to the table hot....I would have been happy just eating them!!! We did have the pizza and again a hit....crispy crust, delicious sauce and just spot on~ Will definitely be back to try their other meals. Owner was gracious and stopped at our table a few times to chat and ask if everything was ok. Fantastic service!

data.title: Garlic rolls to die for!
data.text:
I won a "tour and make your own pizza" in a drawing. Bennett was so gracious. He let me flour, spread, toss, paste, top and put in oven the one we we going to eat. He was wonderful and can't say enough how much fun this was. They also gave us drinks and those marvelous garlic roles!. Wow! Probably the best I have ever had and so said the others with me. 
Great place and really great food.

data.title: Great Pizza and Great Garlic Rolls
data.text: The pizza crust is really good and the toppings are all fresh and tasty. The garlic rolls are just right with just the right amount of oil and garlic. We will be returning for some really great pizza

data.title: Local Italian Fare
data.text: Friendly Italian food with a wide menu. Their pizza 2 slice with drink for $4.99 is a good value as the pizza is crispy and tasty. Did not try anything else but my friend had the meatball sub which he enjoyed

data.title: Great evening spent in a lfamily operated restaurant
data.text: We arrived at the restaurant because our GPS o n the phone directed us to the shopping center. We were greeted no only by a very nice waitress but also the owner, Jeff Cohen.  After placing our order for 2 deep dish pizzas the owner sent us 4 slices of New York style pizza and their special garlic rolls.. all complimentary. We throughly enjoyed our dinner and the ambience. We WILL be back!!

data.title: Great food with home made fresh garlic bread
data.text: I go there on nights on the way home or to college to get pizza to bring home. They have great pizza in the area. The dishes are enough for a second meal. The food is great. Warning about the garlic knots there they are to die for. They are fresh and hot and you can eat  a lot of them without thinking. you will fill up on them before your meal. Take some home for later

data.title: Always forget about him
data.text:
Been here forever so we kind of take it for granted. 
Food was outstanding and service as well. Great value really really good even from a transplanted (22 year Ny er ).

data.title: Delivery to our hotel
data.text: We ordered pizza, garlic rolls, and a chicken parm sub. They were delivered to our hotel room! Everything was really good! Glad the lady at the front desk recommended!

user_location.name: Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, United States

data.title: From not very good to unbelievably excellent, doesn't make since.
data.text: One afternoon I went there to get pizza and chicken pram just to check the food out cause someone was offering gift certificates to the place, they weren't free. I came home to let my wife try it, it was not good. A month later we were meeting a couple people up that way who wanted to meet us there. My wife said maybe we can just get a beer there that she sure didn't want to order anything to eat there. My wife is Italian, her son owns two Italian restaurants, one in Davie and one in Louisiana, some of the best Italian food you could ever have. The couple we met at Pizza Loft were hungry and ordered a pizza, I ended up ordering the ravioli and meatballs. To our surprise the food turned out to be some of the best Italian food we ever had. The sauce the pizza, everything was so different, no comparison, my wife said it had to be two different cooks. You sure can't judge a place by trying it one time.

data.title: Oh my, where do I begin?
data.text: Fabulous food, service and ambiance! Loved every minute of my dining experience! Garlic rolls are a must!

data.title: Work Lunch Catered
data.text: They do a good job on pizza, salad and breadsticks for a work lunch with my office team.  The delivery was on time and the food was hot and the value was reasonable.

data.title: Great for dining in, take out or delivery
data.text:
Excellent Italian food.  Love the pizza-thin, light crust.  Huge dining room, but very popular on the weekends.  
Has Passover pizza, with a crust made from Matzo ball dough-and it's pretty tasty.

data.title: Passover Pizza
data.text: During this Jewish holiday its not to easy to eat out and know exactly what your eating. This restaurant rocks for these holidays. They offer a salad and soup both permitted. The best is Passover Pizza, Passover Lasagna, Passover Eggplant and Passover Chicken Wings. I tries several of these items they were all good but the pizza was AMAZING!!!

data.title: Good pizza, and cold beer!
data.text: I had the meat lovers pizza and it was fantastic, they have a great variety of pizza, good service and decent value.  Also they have a nice cold beer to wash it down.

data.title: Friendly Service meets Great Food
data.text:
All I  can say the whole experience was wonderful..I am a former New Yorker and totally enjoyed the quality of the food. The owner Jeff wants to make you enjoy your food and feel very comfortable.

Just found my new favorite place.
Bill

data.title: An old favorite revisited after finding out about their Gluten Free menu!
data.text:
My family used to go to Pizza Loft regularly.  It is a great family restaurant with the kind of Italian food we like (causal and not frou-frou). We stopped going though after my son was diagnosed with Celiac Disease last April. We don't eat out much unless we are traveling because of potential cross contamination. My son was invited to a birthday party about a week ago though and it was going to be at Pizza Loft. I checked online to see if they had anything gluten free and low-and-behold they have an entire gf menu! I still worry about cross contamination though so I filled in a contact form to get more information about their kitchen. 

It was late at night when I completed the form but that same night the owner emailed me and gave me his cell number so that we could talk the next day. Impressive! I called him and he immediately reassured me by sharing the details of how they cook the pizza and how they handle food allergies. My son was able to go the the party and feel like a regular 12 year old. He had his own gf cheese pizza and he even had (unbreaded) wings as an appetizer.  We were so excited about the menu that I went with the rest of the family to try it out since I only eat gluten free (to support my son). I ordered the gf baked ziti and it was Delicious! My husband ordered the regular ziti and tried mine and said he liked mine better. :) (He liked his too though.) If you are looking for a great pizza (regular or gf), and lots of pasta options and amazing garlic rolls (those are not gf but I remember them being awesome!) in a casual but comfortable environment, you should try Pizza Loft. I know we look forward to being regulars again. :)
